result.execSummary:
The defendant Damion L Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Count 2 and case no. 2012CF3142, credit for 275 days.
***04-30-2015, Judge Fiorenza; Court ordered that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to reflect a total of 275 day of sentence credit on count one.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment or vocational training.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

No alcohol or controlled substances.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No illegal drug dealing or association with drug community (drug users/dealers/houses).

Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy, and taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification program.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge, to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Count 1 and 2012CF3142 with credit for 270 days time served.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Damion L Brown in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Defendant Damion L Brown in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEAR.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR, concurrent with COUNT 2 and Case No. 2012CF3142, credit for 295 days.

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Seek and maintain employment or vocational training
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No illegal drug dealing or association with drug community (drug users/dealers/houses)

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

AS TO COUNT 2:

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with COUNT 1 and 2012CF3142 with credit for 270 days time served.  

Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Damion L Brown in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Defendant Damion L Brown in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to COUNTS 1 AND 2 and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Received and filed.

Count 1:  Bail Jumping (Felony), contrary to WI Stats sec. 946.49(1)(b), 939.50(3)(h).  A class H felony.

Count 2:  Obstructing/ resisting an officer, contrary to WI Stats sec. 946.41(1), 939.51(3)(a).  A class A misdemeanor.

Defendant Damion L Brown in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Damion L Brown in custody.  Kevin Shomin for Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Arraignment is scheduled forthwith to Branch 03.  Arraignment scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Oral No Contact Order with "Jo".

Defendant Damion L Brown in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Defendant Damion L Brown in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor count 2.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
